column5: Our innovative MSc Contemporary Alcohol & Drug Studies course adopts a critical social science perspective to explore the interplay between psychoactive substances and society across a range of areas. Our course will introduce you to a range of:Cross disciplinary theories and conceptsDescriptions and effects of psychoactive substancesPatterns of consumptionApproaches to treatment and relevant policy debatesPolitics of alcohol and drugs policyYou will critically examine patterns of substance use across social groups and the contexts and consequences of substance-related harms for individuals, families and neighbourhoods.
